title: Shipping the package ingestion helper
summary: Added a lightweight package ingestion helper that scans release notes, normalizes metadata, and alerts when deps drift.

title: Deploying 400K context into prod
summary: Rolled out extra-long context for retrieval-heavy features without blowing up latency budgets; shared the rollout gates and metrics to watch.

title: Agentic workflows in customer support
summary: Experimented with agent assist on ticket triage: where summaries help, when humans step back in, and which handoff metrics moved.

title: Inference cost curve, January check-in
summary: Benchmark sweep showed GPU rentals drifting down 8% MoM and context premiums flattening; vLLM optimizations still the cheapest win.

title: Safety evals that actually stuck
summary: Lightweight refusal and jailbreak checks before launch shaved off escalations; captured the harness and thresholds that mattered most.

title: Open-source release radar
summary: Weekly OSS sweep: small edge-friendly models, a tokenizer update cutting memory, and cleaner tracing from a new serving fork.

title: Agents versus traditional GUIs
summary: Notes on when autonomous flows beat menu-driven UX, and the checkpoints needed to keep agent actions explainable.

title: When open-source models actually win
summary: Benchmarks are noisy, but smaller OSS stacks win when latency, control, and cost matter more than SOTA headlines.

title: Safety docs versus deployment reality
summary: Release notes promise red-teaming and eval gates, yet production launches still hinge on rollout scripts and alerting discipline.

title: Eval fatigue is a product problem
summary: Teams drown in dashboards; what they need are opinionated thresholds, auto-triage, and fewer bespoke scorecards.

title: Why this site is static-first
summary: Flat files, zero runtime, and cheap hosting keep the publishing loop tight while still leaving room for richer experiments later.
